main event: A radar object appeared to 'chase' or 'shoot at' a star, disappearing and reappearing multiple times over the course of approximately 25 minutes.
interesting points: The object appeared to be much brighter and larger than the star it was observed near.
The object moved in a straight line with no zigzag pattern.
The object emitted a bluish-white light and a tail of white light as it disappeared.
The object's behavior was described as typical of a meteor or bolide, though it exhibited some unusual characteristics.
The magnetic compass of the aircraft observing the object was affected, and the object was tracked for 577-80 seconds before impact.
sighted object: a bright, large object that appeared to chase and shoot at a star
photographs: no photographs included in the report
